revised_title: Lactic Acid Formation in Frozen Muscles and its Implications
tldr: The study investigates the accumulation of lactic acid in muscles during freezing and finds that it occurs due to the removal of free water from the muscle to form ice. The rate of lactic acid accumulation is determined by the storage temperature, and it is not caused by oxygen deficiency. The research also discovers that the concentration of inorganic ions in the muscle plasma plays a significant role in the formation of lactic acid.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Muscle Physiology
